userStories.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
userStories.tip: The stages of COPD are just labels. Be a rebel. Don't think about them at all. Just live each day to the fullest.

userStories.question: What’s your best coping strategy?
userStories.tip: Don't look at COPD as the dark scary thing that ruined your life. This is just a new chapter in your life. Take the time to enjoy the little things we tend to take for granted when we are healthy. Take time off of work, relax, travel, read, learn something new. There are many online classes you can take for FREE! Spend time doing what you love.

userStories.question: What’s your best coping strategy?
userStories.tip: Always be thankful for what you still have. I look at my beautiful children and grandchildren and it perks me right up.

userStories.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
userStories.tip: Avoiding infections is super important. It is OKAY to ask friends and family to not visit until they are feeling well. Also, ask for help with shopping so you are not in a public place so frequently.

userStories.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
userStories.tip: Pulmonary rehabilitation helped me learn more about COPD, exercise, and I lost 20 pounds! Losing weight is a real struggle when you don't feel confident about exercising. Rehab will help with that.

userStories.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
userStories.tip: Spiriva has been the best for me. I have had insurance issues and had to switch off of it a few times. Each time, I suffered like I was taking nothing to help me. And each time, I have lost lung function. It a medication is working well for you, don't agree to change it unless you are prepared for this possibility.

Join a support group! Support groups can be in person or online and you will be surrounded with people that have the exact same struggles you have. There is always a kind person to talk to at any hour if you join online support groups.
userStories.question: What’s your best coping strategy?
What’s your best coping strategy?
userStories.tip: When one is first diagnosed, depression is very common. Music is a great escape, or a long walk.

userStories.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
userStories.tip: Small, frequent meals are best for people with COPD. You don't want to have a full tummy, or acid reflux.

userStories.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
userStories.tip: If you can get into a pulmonary rehabilitation program, you will learn so much about your illness and how to properly exercise!

userStories.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
userStories.tip: Exercise! Keeping those muscles well oxygenated will be a HUGE benefit to you!

condition.description:
COPD (chronic obstructive pulmonary disease) makes it hard for you to breathe. The two main types are chronic bronchitis and emphysema. The main cause of COPD is long-term exposure to substances that irritate and damage the lungs. This is usually cigarette smoke. Air pollution, chemical fumes, or dust can also cause it.

At first, COPD may cause no symptoms or only mild symptoms. As the disease gets worse, symptoms usually become more severe. They include

  • A cough that produces a lot of mucus
  • Shortness of breath, especially with physical activity
  • Wheezing
  • Chest tightness

Doctors use lung function tests, imaging tests, and blood tests to diagnose COPD. There is no cure. Treatments may relieve symptoms. They include medicines, oxygen therapy, surgery, or a lung transplant. Quitting smoking is the most important step you can take to treat COPD.

NIH: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute

basics.benefits_moa: Advair is a combination medicine. Fluticasone (a corticosteroid) lowers lung inflammation to control asthma and COPD. Salmeterol (a bronchodilator) relaxes muscles in your lungs to open airways and make breathing easier.
basics.bottom_line: Advair is good for people who need two medicines to control their asthma or COPD, but it might be expensive since there's no generic available.
downsides: You have to use Advair every day to control your symptoms.
You can't lower the dose or stop taking it too suddenly.
The HFA inhaler isn't approved to treat COPD.
Can make your heart race.
Steroids can slow height growth in kids.
Because steroids suppress your immune system, you can catch bacterial and viral infections easier, and they can take longer to go away.
There have been some reports of worsening asthma leading to death when taking this medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Asthma-related death
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of worsening asthma leading to death in people taking Advair. It is related to one of the medications in this product. Advair should only be used if your symptoms have not improved with a fast-acting or controller medication alone. If this happens, call 911 or your doctor right away.
risk_factors: Adverse effect of long-acting beta agonist drugs (LABAs), one of the medications in Advair, a combination drug.

risks_warnings.title: Pneumonia
risks_warnings.description: Lung infections and pneumonia have been reported in people using Advair. It is important that your doctor check you since worsening of COPD symptoms may feel similar to pneumonia.
risk_factors: History of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)
COPD includes chronic bronchitis and emphysema

description_processed.orig: Lung infections and pneumonia have been reported in people using Advair. It is important that your doctor check you since worsening of COPD symptoms may feel similar to pneumonia.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression (HPA axis suppression)
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Advair too quickly which is related to one of the medications in the combination. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your medication need to be done slowly and over time. Talk to your doctor before you decrease or stop Advair.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping Advair too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

risks_warnings.title: Mouth and throat infection
risks_warnings.description: One of the medications in Advair may cause a fungal infection of the mouth and throat called thrush. Tell your doctor if you notice white patches inside your mouth or throat or have difficulty swallowing. Your doctor can prescribe medication to treat the infection.
risk_factors: Higher dose of the corticosteroid medication contained in Advair

risks_warnings.title: Difficulty breathing (bronchospasm)
risks_warnings.description: Difficulty breathing (bronchospasm) after inhaling Advair may occur. Call 911 or your doctor right away if a fast-acting asthma inhaler does not stop the attack. Talk to you doctor if your asthma worsens while taking Advair, you may need to discuss increasing the dose or another medication.
risk_factors: Adverse effect of long-acting beta agonist drugs (LABAs), one of the medications in Advair, a combination drug.

risks_warnings.title: Heart disease
risks_warnings.description: Advair may increase blood pressure and heart rate, especially if you already have these conditions. These symptoms are related to one of the medications in this product so don't change or increase your dose without talking to your doctor first. Tell your doctor if you develop dizziness, tremor, nausea, rapid heartbeat, become very tired or have difficulty sleeping while taking Advair, you may need to change or stop this medication.
risk_factors: History of arrhythmia, hypertension or heart failure

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of severe allergic reactions in people taking Advair who have severe milk protein allergy. This reaction occurs with Advair Diskus after inhaling the powder which contains lactose. Call 911 or your doctor right away if you develop severe rash, itching, swelling or difficulty breathing while taking Advair. You should not use Advair Diskus if you are tested or know about this allergy.

risks_warnings.title: Eye problems
risks_warnings.description: Combivent should not be sprayed toward the face or in the eyes. It can cause new eye pain, blurry vision, vision changes or worsen already existing eye problems. Tell your doctor if you notice new symptoms or worsening eye problems from accidentally spraying Combivent into your eye or during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Difficulty urinating
risks_warnings.description: People with an enlarged prostate or urinary obstruction have reported worsening of symptoms.  Tell your doctor right away if it is difficult or painful to urinate while taking Combivent.  Your doctor may discuss other medications to treat your COPD.
risk_factors: History of urinary bladder blockage (urinary obstruction)

description_processed.orig: People with an enlarged prostate or urinary obstruction have reported worsening of symptoms.  Tell your doctor right away if it is difficult or painful to urinate while taking Combivent.  Your doctor may discuss other medications to treat your COPD.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of severe allergic reactions in people taking Combivent with a history of atropine allergy. Combivent has a chemical structure similar to atropine so if you've had an allergic reaction to atropine, there is a possibility you will be allergic to Combivent. Call 911 or your doctor right away if you develop severe rash, itching, swelling or difficulty breathing while taking Combivent. Talk to your doctor about other medication choices to treat your COPD if you know you have an allergy to the drug atropine.

risks_warnings.title: Low potassium
risks_warnings.description: One of the medications in Combivent causes potassium levels in the body to decrease, sometimes significantly. Low potassium levels can worsen existing heart problems or cause new symptoms. Let your doctor know about other medications you are taking and if needed, get your potassium checked periodically.

Talk to your doctor about other medication choices to treat your COPD if you know you have food allergies to soybean and/or peanuts.

You should not use Spiriva if you are tested or know about this allergy.

risks_warnings.title: Reduced kidney function
risks_warnings.description: The kidney is mainly responsible for removing Spiriva from the body so people with kidney disease or reduced function need to be watched closely. Spiriva can build up in the body and cause certain side effects. Tell your doctor if you develop dry mouth, blurry vision, confusion, sweating, increased heart rate or constipation. You may need to discuss other medication options to treat your COPD.
risk_factors: History of moderate to severe kidney disease

risks_warnings.title: Feeling dizzy

carousel_items: Lowers inflammation and opens airways to improve breathing.
Prevents breathing problems, but doesn't stop sudden cough or wheezing once they start.
Starts working in about 30 minutes, but can take 1 to 2 weeks to feel full effects.
Use inhaler in a level position, and don't breathe out into the device.
Rinse your mouth out with water after each use.
Shake inhaler for 5 seconds before you use it.
Pump the inhaler 4 times before inhaling the first dose, or if it's been more than a month since your last dose.
Call 911 or your doctor if it's hard to breathe, or if you have an asthma attack while taking this medication.

basics.benefits_moa: Symbicort is a combination medicine. Budesonide (a corticosteroid) lowers lung inflammation to control asthma and COPD. Formoterol (a bronchodilator) relaxes muscles in your lungs to open airways and make breathing easier.
basics.bottom_line: Symbicort is good for people who need two medicines to control their asthma or COPD, but it might be expensive since there's no generic available.
downsides: You have to use Symbicort twice a day, every day to control your symptoms.
You can't lower the dose or stop taking it too suddenly.
Lower doses are not as effective for COPD.
Can make your heart race.
Steroids can slow height growth in kids.
Because steroids suppress your immune system, you can catch bacterial and viral infections easier, and they can take longer to go away.
There have been some reports of worsening asthma leading to death when taking this medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Asthma-related death
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of worsening asthma leading to death in people taking Symbicort. It is related to one of the medications in this product. Symbicort should only be used if your symptoms have not improved with a fast-acting or controller medication alone. If this happens, call 911 or your doctor right away.
risk_factors: Adverse effect of long-acting beta agonist drugs (LABAs), one of the medications in Symbicort, a combination drug.

description_processed.orig: There are reports of worsening asthma leading to death in people taking Symbicort. It is related to one of the medications in this product. Symbicort should only be used if your symptoms have not improved with a fast-acting or controller medication alone. If this happens, call 911 or your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Pneumonia
risks_warnings.description: Lung infections and pneumonia have been reported in people using Symbicort. It is important that your doctor monitor you since worsening of COPD symptoms may feel similar to pneumonia.
risk_factors: History of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)
COPD includes chronic bronchitis and emphysema

description_processed.orig: Lung infections and pneumonia have been reported in people using Symbicort. It is important that your doctor monitor you since worsening of COPD symptoms may feel similar to pneumonia.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression (HPA axis suppression)
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Symbicort too quickly which is related to one of the medications in the combination. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your medication need to be done slowly and over time. Talk to your doctor before you decrease or stop Symbicort.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

risks_warnings.title: Mouth and throat infection
risks_warnings.description: One of the medications in Symbicort may cause a fungal infection of the mouth and throat called thrush. Tell your doctor if you notice white patches inside your mouth or throat or have difficulty swallowing. Your doctor can prescribe medication to treat the infection.
risk_factors: Higher dose of the corticosteroid medication contained in Symbicort

description_processed.orig: One of the medications in Symbicort may cause a fungal infection of the mouth and throat called thrush. Tell your doctor if you notice white patches inside your mouth or throat or have difficulty swallowing. Your doctor can prescribe medication to treat the infection.

risks_warnings.title: Difficulty breathing (bronchospasm)
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of difficulty breathing (bronchospasm) after inhaling Symbicort. Call 911 or your doctor right away if a fast-acting asthma inhaler does not stop the attack. Talk to you doctor if your asthma worsens while taking Symbicort, you may need to discuss increasing the dose or another medication.
risk_factors: Adverse effect of long-acting beta agonist drugs (LABAs) found in Symbicort, a combination medication.

description_processed.orig: There are reports of difficulty breathing (bronchospasm) after inhaling Symbicort. Call 911 or your doctor right away if a fast-acting asthma inhaler does not stop the attack. Talk to you doctor if your asthma worsens while taking Symbicort, you may need to discuss increasing the dose or another medication.

risks_warnings.title: Heart disease
risks_warnings.description: Symbicort may increase blood pressure and heart rate, especially if you already have these conditions. These symptoms are related to one of the medications in this product so don't change or increase your dose without talking to your doctor first. Tell your doctor if you develop dizziness, tremor, nausea, rapid heartbeat, become very tired or have difficulty sleeping while taking Symbicort, you may need to change or stop this medication.
risk_factors: History of arrhythmia, hypertension or heart failure

basics.benefits_moa: Albuterol is a bronchodilator. It relaxes the muscles that tighten your lungs during an asthma attack. This opens airways and makes breathing easier.
basics.bottom_line: Albuterol is good at stopping asthma attacks and helping you breathe.
downsides: Can make your heart race temporarily.

downsides_processed.orig: Can make your heart race temporarily.

upsides: Stops asthma attacks.
Can also help prevent asthma attacks caused by exercise.
While there are technically no generic versions of Albuterol, there are many competing brands, which keeps prices pretty low.

basics.benefits_moa: Prednisone is a corticosteroid that's similar to what your body naturally makes. It reduces swelling and other immune responses that can cause you pain, discomfort, or harm.
basics.bottom_line: Prednisone is a common oral corticosteroid that's great for controlling the unwanted symptoms from your immune responses and will make you feel better. There are lots of side effects but most of are tolerable or can be managed.
downsides: Lots of side effects, especially with long term use.
Short-term use can cause mood changes, trouble sleeping and increase in blood pressure, blood sugar, and possible water retention.
Long-term use can cause problems with skin, bone, eye health and put you at a higher risk for infections.
People with certain conditions will have to pay extra attention to their symptoms or may have to adjust the dose of other medicines when taking Prednisone.
When using corticosteroids for more than 1 week, you will need to work with a doctor to get off the medicine slowly.
Only available as an oral medicine so the rest of your body will be exposed to the medicine.

upsides: Steroid magic, can help you feel better, have more energy and get more appetite.
Useful for many conditions.
Short-term use in controlling immune responses that are causing you discomfort, and works quickly to relieve symptoms like swelling, rash, asthma attacks, gout attacks.
Long-term use in suppressing the immune system from causing your body harm, like many autoimmune related conditions.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression (HPA axis suppression)
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Prednisone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Prednisone dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

description_processed.orig: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Prednisone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Prednisone dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk for infections
risks_warnings.description: If you take Prednisone for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Prednisone. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Prednisone if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.
risk_factors: Contact with people who have viral illness
History of bacterial or viral conditions

Talk to your doctor before taking Prednisone if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.

risks_warnings.title: Kaposi's sarcoma
risks_warnings.description: It’s rare, but taking Prednisone for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposi’s sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Prednisone and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Eye problems
risks_warnings.description: Prednisone may cause cataracts or glaucoma, increased eye pressure and possibly eye nerve damage. You may also be more at risk for certain eye infections. Don't take if you have herpes simplex of the eye.  Let your doctor know if you have blurry vision, eye pain or any vision changes.

risks_warnings.title: Psychiatric changes
risks_warnings.description: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Prednisone may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

risks_warnings.title: Bone effects
risks_warnings.description: Prednisone can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

description_processed.orig: Prednisone can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Taking Prednisone if your pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma). If you're taking Prednisone to treat an autoimmune condition like rheumatoid arthritis or for antirejection treatment after a transplant, there are disease registries that you'll need to contact so make sure you talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach and intestinal problems
risks_warnings.description: Taking Prednisone increases the risk of injury to the lining of your stomach and intestine including irritation, tears/holes and ulcers. You should avoid alcohol/alcoholic beverages because it can worsen stomach irritation. Tell your doctor or get medical care right away if you have stomach pain, notice blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.

carousel_items: Can cause nervousness, fast heartbeat, lightheadedness, and dry mouth.

Take Terbutaline regularly to prevent asthma attacks. It doesn't work right away, so it won't control an asthma attack immediately.

basics.benefits_moa: Terbutaline is a bronchodilator. It relaxes the muscles in your lungs to open airways and make breathing easier.
basics.bottom_line: Terbutaline is effective at preventing asthma attacks, but isn’t the first choice. It’s generally well-tolerated, but let your doctor know if you feel more lightheaded or have a rapid heartbeat while taking this medicine.
downsides: Only lasts about six hours.
Can raise your blood sugars. If you have diabetes, check your sugars regularly and let your doctor know if they’re higher than usual.
Takes about 30 to 45 minutes to start working, so it won’t help an asthma attack once it starts.

risks_warnings.title: Premature labor
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes people will use Terbutaline to prevent premature labor. This purpose has not been FDA-approved and should not be used beyond 48-72 hours. Serious reactions, including death, high blood sugars, low blood potassium, and abnormal heart rhythms have happened to pregnant women who were given Terbutaline for premature labor.

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: The stages of COPD are just labels. Be a rebel. Don't think about them at all. Just live each day to the fullest.

surveys.question: What’s your best coping strategy?
surveys.tip: Don't look at COPD as the dark scary thing that ruined your life. This is just a new chapter in your life. Take the time to enjoy the little things we tend to take for granted when we are healthy. Take time off of work, relax, travel, read, learn something new. There are many online classes you can take for FREE! Spend time doing what you love.

surveys.question: What’s your best coping strategy?
surveys.tip: Always be thankful for what you still have. I look at my beautiful children and grandchildren and it perks me right up.

surveys.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
surveys.tip: Avoiding infections is super important. It is OKAY to ask friends and family to not visit until they are feeling well. Also, ask for help with shopping so you are not in a public place so frequently.

surveys.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
surveys.tip: Pulmonary rehabilitation helped me learn more about COPD, exercise, and I lost 20 pounds! Losing weight is a real struggle when you don't feel confident about exercising. Rehab will help with that.

surveys.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
surveys.tip: Spiriva has been the best for me. I have had insurance issues and had to switch off of it a few times. Each time, I suffered like I was taking nothing to help me. And each time, I have lost lung function. It a medication is working well for you, don't agree to change it unless you are prepared for this possibility.

Join a support group! Support groups can be in person or online and you will be surrounded with people that have the exact same struggles you have. There is always a kind person to talk to at any hour if you join online support groups.
surveys.question: What’s your best coping strategy?
What’s your best coping strategy?
surveys.tip: When one is first diagnosed, depression is very common. Music is a great escape, or a long walk.

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: Small, frequent meals are best for people with COPD. You don't want to have a full tummy, or acid reflux.

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: If you can get into a pulmonary rehabilitation program, you will learn so much about your illness and how to properly exercise!

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: Exercise! Keeping those muscles well oxygenated will be a HUGE benefit to you!
